title: Ticket #4531: configuration variables missing from manual
description:
These variables are missing from the manual. These variables exist due to scaling issues: to reduce the time spent servicing already- connected clients.

CCB_POLLING_TIMESLICE default: 0.05 (5%), of all the time CCB is running, defines the percent/max/target to poll/service/check on already connected clients.

CCB_POLLING_INTERVAL default: 20 sec, smallest amount of time that would go by before we start another polling. The interval (the value of this configuration variable does not change) can be extended if the measured amount of time previously taken to poll/check on already connected clients exceeded the amount of time desired, as expressed with CCB_POLLING_TIMESLICE.

CCB_POLLING_MAX_INTERVAL default: 600 sec, No matter what, poll every 600 seconds.

CCB_SERVER_READ_BUFFER default: 2Kbytes, Size of the kernel TCP read buffer for all sockets used by CCB.

CCB_SERVER_WRITE_BUFFER default: 2Kbytes, Size of the kernel TCP write buffer for all sockets used by CCB.

CCB_SWEEP_INTERVAL default: 1200 seconds (20 minutes), Frequency at which the CCB server writes its info about open TCP connections to a file, such that crash recovery from the info can be done.

CCB_RECONNECT_FILE default: $(SPOOL)/.ccb_reconnect, Path and name of the file into which we write this info.
